result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel P Blazejovsky

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel P Blazejovsky in court.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Daniel P Blazejovsky.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling  Conference. Defense request a resolution hearing.  
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel P Blazejovsky in court.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Daniel P Blazejovsky.  
Attorney William Ackell for Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant appears.  Defense in receipt of discovery and waiting for an Offer.
State will provide defense an offer when he receive the Drug Panel. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.  
Defense advises the court his client had transportation issues and request an adjournment. State does not object.
Defense is missing some discovery. State will follow up.   Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
 Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Calendar call scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel P Blazejovsky in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer J. Komorowski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Daniel P Blazejovsky in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Daniel P Blazejovsky in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel P Blazejovsky appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
